conclusion: Analyze the path of the liquid from each opening (A, B, C, and D) and see how the baffles direct the flow.
Liquid from opening A will hit the first pink baffle angled downward to the right.
Liquid from opening A will follow the angle of the pink baffle and move downward to the right.
Liquid from opening A will then hit the cyan baffle angled downward to the left.
Liquid from opening A will follow the cyan baffle's angle and move downward to the left, directing it towards container E.
Liquid from opening B will hit the pink baffle angled downward to the right.
Liquid from opening B will follow the angle of the pink baffle and move downward to the right.
Liquid from opening B will then hit the cyan baffle angled downward to the left.
Liquid from opening B will follow the cyan baffle's angle and move downward to the left, directing it towards container E.
Liquid from opening C will hit the green baffle angled downward to the left.
Liquid from opening C will follow the angle of the green baffle and move downward to the left.
Liquid from opening C will then hit the white baffle angled downward to the right.
Liquid from opening C will follow the white baffle's angle and move downward to the right, directing it towards container F.
Liquid from opening D will hit the white baffle angled downward to the right.
Liquid from opening D will follow the angle of the white baffle and move downward to the right.
Liquid from opening D will then hit the cyan baffle angled downward to the left.
Liquid from opening D will follow the cyan baffle's angle and move downward to the left, directing it towards container F.
Liquid from openings A and B will flow into container E.
Liquid from openings C and D will flow into container F.
